mentions.context: • System P is the popular PostgreSQL system [15], where f is the function that returns the cost estimated by PostgreSQL using the explain API; • System P' is also the PostgreSQL system, but where f is the cost function that we propose in this paper.
Figure 3: Query rank by percentile for GMark [2]
We experimentally demonstrate the benefits of this technique for recursive queries evaluated with PostgreSQL.

• System P is the popular PostgreSQL system [15], where f is the function that returns the cost estimated by PostgreSQL using the explain API; • System P' is also the PostgreSQL system, but where f is the cost function that we propose in this paper.

We experiment with two kinds of datasets: a real-world dataset: Yago2s [16] and two synthetic datasets (Shop and Uniprot) generated by the GMark system [2] obtained for the 20 queries over Yago2s found in [10], and for 10 randomly generated queries for each synthetic dataset.
Experiments show that our cost estimation technique improves the performance of recursive query evaluation on popular relational database engines such as PostgreSQL.
Experiments with a prototype of the approach show that this improves the performance of recursive query evaluation on popular relational database engines such as Post-greSQL.

• System P is the popular PostgreSQL system [15], where f is the function that returns the cost estimated by PostgreSQL using the explain API; • System P' is also the PostgreSQL system, but where f is the cost function that we propose in this paper.
